title: card.aux Request Application Programming Interface (API) Schema
description: Configure various uses of the general-purpose I/O (GPIO) pins AUX1-AUX4 on the Notecard edge connector for tracking applications and simple GPIO sensing and counting tasks.

sub-descriptions.description: Device Firmware Update mode for flashing firmware.
General-purpose I/O mode for digital input/output operations.
LED control mode for visual status indication.
Monitor mode for data collection and observation.
Motion detection mode using built-in accelerometer.
NeoPixel control mode for RGB LED strips.
Combined NeoPixel and monitor mode with visual feedback.
Disable AUX functionality completely.
Location tracking mode for GPS operations.
Combined tracking and monitor mode.
Combined tracking, NeoPixel, and monitor mode.
Reset to default AUX configuration.

usage.description: An ordered list of pin modes for each AUX pin when in GPIO mode

sub-descriptions.description: No specific configuration for this pin.
Disable this AUX pin.
Set pin to high output state.
Set pin to low output state.
Configure pin as digital input.
Configure pin as input with internal pull-down resistor.
Configure pin as input with internal pull-up resistor.
Count rising edges on this pin.
Count rising edges with internal pull-down resistor.
Count rising edges with internal pull-up resistor.

seconds.description: When in gpio mode, if an AUX pin is configured as a count type, the count of rising edges can be broken into samples of this duration

max.description: When in gpio mode, if an AUX pin is configured as a count type, the maximum number of samples of duration seconds

start.description: When in gpio mode, if an AUX pin is configured as a count type, set to true to reset counters and start incrementing

gps.description: Deprecated. If true, along with mode:track the Notecard supports the use of an external GPS module

rate.description: The AUX UART baud rate for debug communication over the AUXRX and AUXTX pins

sync.description: If true, for pins set as input by usage, the Notecard will autonomously report any state changes as new notes in file

file.description: The name of the Notefile used to report state changes when used in conjunction with sync:true

connected.description: If true, defers the sync of the state change Notefile to the next sync as configured by the hub.set request

limit.description: If true, along with mode:track and gps:true the Notecard will disable concurrent modem use during GPS tracking

sensitivity.description: When used with mode:neo-monitor or mode:track-neo-monitor, this controls the brightness of NeoPixel lights

ms.description: When in gpio mode, this argument configures a debouncing interval

count.description: When used with mode:neo-monitor or mode:track-neo-monitor, this controls the number of NeoPixels to use in a strip

offset.description: When used with mode:neo-monitor or mode:track-neo-monitor, this is the 1-based index in a strip of NeoPixels
